headline.main: WAR ZONE REPEAL, SHIP ARMS VOTED BY SENATE GROUP; Committee, 13 to 10, Reports Bill to Kill All Main Bans Left in Neutrality Act

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 -- The Senate Foreign Relations Committee approved today, and reported to the Senate by a vote of 13 to 10, a measure to repeal all remaining important provisions of the Neutrality Act and thus untie the hands of the Administration in carrying out fundamental foreign policies.
abstract: ship arming and zone repeal amendments approved by com; Sen George's vote added to majority for amendment; debate set; comment by Sens Shipstead, George, Nye and others; action praised by Willkie; Ital press and radio comment
